snippet.title: Hang-On playthrough - Sega Master System
snippet.description:
This was the first game that many Master System owners got to play. It was built in to several versions of the original Master System, sometimes along with Safari Hunt.

Hang-On was based on the arcade game of the same name, and is one of very few Sega games to have been released in some form or another on each one of Sega's consoles. This conversion is quite simplistic, but demonstrates some of the Master System's potential well. 

The aim of the game is to get to the end of the course without running out of time. Each course is split into five stages, with time extensions being earned when crossing each checkpoint. Complete the course once, and you get to do it again, and again, and again. The course changes slightly each time, but the gameplay remains identical, meaning it quickly becomes quite tedious. In total there are eight courses, before the game moves up a level and you begin the courses again.

This playthrough video is of a ride through all eight courses. I could have carried on, but I suspect that the game will never have ended, so I deliberately ran out of time during the second loop of courses. I don't imagine that this is the most thrilling of videos to watch, but things got a bit sweaty during course 7 where I very nearly ran out of time. It was a tense moment, as I'm sure this video demonstrates...
